content.question: A student prepares the setup shown in the figure and then shines low-intensity ultraviolet light on metal plate <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. When no potential difference is applied to the circuit, the ammeter still registers electric current. How will the ammeter reading be affected if the potential difference is gradually increased?

choices.label: The current will increase as <math alttext="V sub power supply" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>w</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>r</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>s</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is increased.

The current will decrease and will stay zero after a certain <math alttext="V sub power supply" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>w</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>r</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>s</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> value.

The current will decrease and reach zero, and as <math alttext="V sub power supply" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>w</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>r</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>s</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is further increased the current will increase again.

The current will stay the same regardless of how much <math alttext="V sub power supply" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>w</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>r</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>s</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is applied.

content.answer: The current will decrease and will stay zero after a certain <math alttext="V sub power supply" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>V</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>p</mi><mi>o</mi><mi>w</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>r</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>s</mi><mi>u</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>p</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> value.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
